intro: Brodiaea uniflora var. conspicua, commonly known as the showy brodiaea, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces a single, showy flower per stem, which blooms in late spring or early summer. The leaves are narrow and grass-like, forming a basal rosette that helps conserve moisture.
